taxon_name.authority: Willdenow in C. M. von Sternberg

place_of_publication.publication_title: in C. M. von Sternberg, Revis. Saxifrag.

bio:treatment.description: Plants in solitary clumps, stoloniferous, slenderly rhizom-atous. Leaves basal and cauline; petiole absent; blade oblong-lanceolate or elliptic to obovate, unlobed, 5–20 mm, fleshy, margins entire, sparsely to densely, coarsely glandular-ciliate, distal sometimes ciliate, apex acute to ± obtuse, mucronate, surfaces glabrous. Inflorescences 2–3(–5)-flowered, lax cymes, sometimes solitary flowers, 1–15 cm, densely purplish-tipped stipitate-glandular; bracts sessile. Flowers: sepals erect, elliptic or oblong-ovate, margins stipitate glandular-ciliate, surfaces stipitate-glandular; petals yellow, not spotted, elliptic to broadly obovate, 4–9(–10) mm, longer than sepals; ovary superior to ca. 1/2 inferior.
North America, Asia (c Asia, Caucasus, Russian Far East, Siberia), Atlantic Islands (Svalbard).
bio:treatment.other_name: Stoloniferous or spider or spider-legged saxifrage
bio:treatment.discussion: Although sometimes reported from North America, subspecies flagellaris is not present in the flora area; it is native in Eurasia.
